description: President Donald Trump is considering exempting certain agricultural products from tariffs imposed on Canada and Mexico, the latest move by the administration on Wednesday to offer relief to certain sectors from the sweeping new import taxes.
title: Trump Weighs Agriculture Carveouts to Canada, Mexico Tariffs

description: The UK and Ireland plan to share more data and slash red tape in a bid to boost energy security as thee two countries seek a tighter relationship after years of post-Brexit tension.
title: UK Strikes Data Deal With Ireland in Bid to Lift Energy Security

description: President Donald Trump warned Hamas there will be “hell to pay” if the militant group doesn’t immediately release its hostages in Gaza.
title: Trump Warns Hamas of ‘Hell to Pay’ If Hostages Aren’t Released

description: More than 36.6 million people watched President Donald Trump’s speech to a joint session of Congress on Tuesday, according to Nielsen ratings. It was the first time the president addressed the legislative branch after taking office for his second term in January.
title: Trump Congress Speech Gets 36.6 Million Viewers, Tops Biden

description: A more decisive shift toward domestic consumption is needed to meet the country’s long-term goals.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Push Xi to Overhaul China’s Ailing Growth Model

description: Tesla y SpaceX dependían de su mano de obra, mientras que Musk abogaba por una represión fronteriza
title: Los migrantes indocumentados que construyeron la gigafábrica de Elon Musk

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Stephanie Lai looks at the push and pull on the president’s agenda. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: The Trump Roller Coaster Ride Keeps Going for Investors, Allies

description: Cutting IRS staffing in half over the next 10 months would mean less help and longer waits for many US taxpayers and increase the risk that wealthy tax cheats escape paying what they owe.
title: Wealthy Tax Cheats Set to Benefit From Trump Plans to Halve IRS

description: The Canadian province of Alberta is halting purchases of US alcohol and changing its procurement practices to respond to President Donald Trump’s tariffs on US imports of Canadian goods.
title: Alberta to Cut US Alcohol, Change Procurement in Retaliation Against Trump

description: The Justice Department opened an investigation into the University of California for possible antisemitism in its treatment of Jewish employees, following the widespread pro-Palestinian protests on multiple campuses after the October 2023 attack on Israel by Hamas.
title: US Probes University of California for Workplace Antisemitism

description: Former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo is leading Mayor Eric Adams and all other candidates by a wide margin in New York City’s June Democratic mayoral primary race, a new poll shows.
title: Cuomo Has Wide Lead in Race for New York City Mayor, Poll Shows

description: Portugal could face early elections in May if the government loses a confidence vote in parliament next week, President Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa said.
title: Portugal Could Hold Snap Election in May as Premier Lacks Allies

description: President Emmanuel Macron said he’ll enter into talks on using France’s nuclear capabilities to defend European allies.
title: Macron Says France in Talks to Extend Nuclear Shield for Europe

description: Keir Starmer’s popularity rating rose to the highest level since September after he gathered European leaders in London to create a UK and France-led “coalition of the willing” to safeguard Ukraine.
title: Starmer’s Popularity Rises to Six-Month High After Ukraine Talks

description: A federal judge denied New York’s request for an immediate return of $80 million that the Trump administration clawed back after the money had been awarded to the city as reimbursement for shelter provided to migrants.
title: Judge Refuses NYC Bid for US to Return $80 Million in FEMA Funds

description: Less than 24 hours after Donald Trump’s remarks to Congress praising Elon Musk’s leadership of his “government efficiency” effort, federal workers suing over the billionaire’s role cited the comments in court as the latest instance of the president’s statements bolstering their case.
title: Trump’s Nod to Musk in Speech to Congress Swiftly Cited in Court

description: Trump’s top hostage negotiator has met with Hamas officials in Qatar, the White House confirmed Wednesday, a rare instance of direct contact by US officials with a group designated a terrorist organization.
title: Trump’s Envoy Meets With Hamas on Hostages in Rare Contact

description: Canada is expanding its criteria for intervention in foreign investment, adding a provision that would allow it to reject purchases and takeovers that it views as posing harm to the country’s broader “economic security.”
title: Canada Expands Foreign Takeover Oversight Amid Tariff Dispute

description: A memo sent to staffers at the Department of Veterans Affairs said that the agency plans to return to pre-2019 staffing levels, according to a screen shot seen by Bloomberg News, meaning tens of thousands of employees could lose their jobs.
title: Veterans Agency Eyes Cutting Roughly 80,000 Staff in DOGE Revamp

description: Two of President Donald Trump’s top economic chiefs from his first term refrained from backing his current approach of jacking up import duties on a range of trading partners to levels unseen in decades.
title: Trump First-Term Economy Chiefs Refrain From Backing Tariff Plan

description: A key lab that oversees US pharmaceutical safety is in limbo due to cuts from the Department of Government Efficiency this week, raising questions about the fate of the lab and the new administration’s approach to expensive but crucial research that aims to keep America’s product supply safe.
title: Musk’s DOGE Cuts Target FDA Lab Guarding US Drug Supply

description: The Italian government is having growing doubts about closing a €1.5 billion ($1.6 billion) deal with Elon Musk’s Starlink in light of the US pullback from commitments to European security, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Italy Is Getting Cold Feet Over Deal to Use Musk’s Starlink

description: President Donald Trump is asking American growers to bear with him as tariffs threaten to hurt their business and deepen a farm downturn that’s entering a third year.
title: Trump Says ‘Bear With Me’ as Tariffs Squeeze American Farmers

description: Officials from Ukraine and the US will soon meet to resume discussions about peace and security, said top Ukrainian presidential aide Andriy Yermak on Telegram following his call with US National Security Adviser Mike Waltz on Wednesday.
title: Zelenskiy Top Aide Says US and Ukraine Negotiators to Meet Soon

description: Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer predicted Wednesday that President Donald Trump’s effort to repeal subsidies for semiconductor factories will fail.
title: Schumer Predicts Trump’s Effort to Repeal Chips Money Will Fail

description: The Trump administration is considering a one-month delay for automakers from newly imposed tariffs on Mexico and Canada, according to people familiar with the matter, as a temporary reprieve following pleas from industry leaders.
title: US Weighs One-Month Delay of Auto Tariffs on Canada, Mexico

description: Republican lawmakers repeatedly attacked four big-city US mayors during a contentious congressional hearing on immigration, claiming their sanctuary policies are interfering with President Donald Trump’s plans for mass deportations.
title: US Mayors Face Attacks From GOP Lawmakers on Sanctuary Cities

description: The UK, France and Germany said an escalation of Iran’s nuclear program poses a serious threat to international security and called on the Islamic Republic to halt and reverse its atomic activities.
title: UK, France and Germany Urge Iran to Reverse Nuclear Escalation

description: A key House Republican projected Wednesday that the US could hit the debt ceiling as soon as mid-May, several months sooner than projected.
title: Key House Republican Warns Debt-Ceiling Breach Possible in May

description: Panama’s president accused Donald Trump of lying to congress after the US leader reiterated his intention to take over the Panama canal.
title: Panama’s President Accuses Trump of Lying to Congress Over Canal

description: Mozambican police fired on a key opposition leader’s convoy on Wednesday, hours before President Daniel Chapo signed a plan with other political leaders to end unrest that’s rocked the southeast African nation since October’s disputed elections.
title: Mozambique Police Fire on Opposition Ahead of Deal to End Unrest

description: The Trump administration has reversed its decision to list nearly 80 million square feet of federal property for possible sale, another setback for President Donald Trump’s efforts to significantly shrink the size of the federal government.
title: Trump Agency Pulls 443 Sites Off Market in Real Estate Reversal

description: Billionaire Elon Musk will meet with Republican lawmakers on Wednesday as Congress grapples with the implications of his Department of Government Efficiency, which has recommended massive spending cuts across the federal government.
title: Musk to Meet With Congressional Republicans on DOGE Cuts

description: Investors are snapping up bonds sold by colleges with near-junk credit ratings in a push for higher-yielding assets — even as concerns linger about the challenges facing small, private institutions.
title: Investors Rush to Buy Near-Junk College Bonds Even as Risks Grow

description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s minority government will seek a confidence vote that it may lose, raising the possibility of an early election.
title: Portugal’s Premier Seeks Confidence Vote, May Face Election

description: Former Chilean President Michelle Bachelet said she won’t run for head of state in this year’s election, resisting pressure for her to represent the center-left in a field that’s dominated by opposition contenders.
title: Michelle Bachelet Closes Door to Third Run for Chile Presidency

description: Guinea will hold general elections this year to bring an end to more than three years of military rule in the world’s biggest exporter of bauxite.
title: Guinea Plans Vote to End More Than Three Years of Military Rule

description: India’s monetary authority will pump in another $21.5 billion worth of cash via bond purchases and a forex swap as the banking system braces for financial year-end tightness in liquidity before March 31.
title: RBI to Infuse $21.5 Billion of Cash to Ease India Liquidity

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is not open to lifting Canada’s full package of retaliatory tariffs if US President Donald Trump leaves any tariffs on Canada in place, according to a senior Canadian government official.
title: Canada Won’t Scrap Tariffs Unless All US Levies Are Lifted, Official Says

description: Greenland’s Prime Minister Mute B. Egede ratcheted up his message to President Donald Trump, stressing the island is “not for sale and cannot simply be taken” after another US push to gain control of the Arctic territory.
title: Trump ‘Must Understand’ Greenland Isn’t for Sale, PM Egede Says

description: The US Supreme Court dealt a blow to President Donald Trump’s foreign-aid freeze, reinstating a lower court order that requires the quick disbursement of as much as $2 billion owed to contractors for already completed work.
title: Supreme Court Rejects Trump on USAID Foreign-Aid Freeze

description: President Donald Trump is set to announce changes to the tariffs on Canada and Mexico he slapped on earlier this week, with potential relief for automobiles and other sectors, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said Wednesday.
title: Trump to Decide on Canada, Mexico Relief Today, Lutnick Says

description: The worst enemy of a booming market for mergers and acquisitions has always been uncertainty. That’s a problem for dealmakers, who were expecting a banner year under Donald Trump but have instead crashed into the harsh reality of the US president’s market-rattling trade wars and geopolitical clashes.
title: Dealmakers Are Losing Ground as Hopes of Trump Rally Fade Fast

description: More than a year after Javier Milei became president, strict exchange controls remain the biggest hurdle for foreign investors looking to allocate funds toward Argentine assets.
title: All the Big FX and Capital Controls Milei Needs to End This Year

description: Russia’s war with Ukraine and the worldwide shift toward national priorities has pushed African leaders to focus on food self-sufficiency, the head of a United Nations’ body said.
title: As World’s Priorities Shift, African Leaders Focus on Food Sovereignty

description: Ukrainian authorities are still receiving US intelligence, an official in Kyiv said, pushing back against a report that the administration of President Donald Trump had halted intelligence sharing on Russia’s war.
title: Ukrainian Official Says Country Is Receiving US Intelligence

description: Kazakhstan plans to buy $1 billion of inflation-protected US Treasuries in a wager that President Donald Trump’s policies will stall progress in bringing down inflation.
title: Kazakhstan’s Trump Trade Is a $1 Billion Bet on Inflation-Hedging Bonds

description: Greece’s opposition parties will submit a censure motion against the government Wednesday, criticizing Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis’s administration for its handling of the nation’s deadliest train crash two years ago.
title: Greek Opposition to Submit Censure Motion on Deadly Train Crash

description: Germany called for the European Union to reform its fiscal rules to allow countries to make bigger defense expenditures without running afoul of the bloc’s budget rules, according to people familiar with the talks.
title: Germany Urges EU to Ease Fiscal Rules to Boost Defense Funds

description: South Sudanese security forces detained the nation’s petroleum minister, a day after the arrest of a senior military official amid escalating tensions in the oil-exporting East African nation.
title: South Sudan Petroleum Minister Detained in Opposition Crackdown

description: President Xi Jinping signaled China’s determination to push ahead with an ambitious growth goal this year, despite the trade war. If Donald Trump boosts tariffs further, analysts say Beijing will need to unleash big stimulus to hit the target.
title: Xi’s Growth Goal Will Need Big Stimulus If Trade War Escalates

description: The billionaire overseeing a wide-ranging government efficiency effort is offering his own SpaceX technology as the future of flight-safety inside the Federal Aviation Administration
title: How Elon Musk Muscled His Way Into the FAA

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Awakes Sleeping Giant Germany to Boost EU Defense

description: Germany plans to unleash hundreds of billions of euros in debt-backed financing for defense and infrastructure investments in a historic shift to overhaul its notoriously tight limits on government borrowing.
title: Germany Embarks on Massive Fiscal Reform Push: What to Watch

description: Vietnam’s industry and trade minister is scheduled to travel to the US to meet US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer next week to discuss the “very good relationship” between the two, as the Southeast Asian nation seeks to avert the threat of tariffs.
title: Vietnam Trade Minister to Meet US Representative Next Week

description: Chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz plans to free Germany from the fiscal straitjacket that former leader Angela Merkel had locked her country into for more than a decade, a move that will revolutionize public finances and pave the way for Europe’s most powerful economy to bulk up the region’s defense.
title: Merz Rips Up Merkel’s Legacy to Unleash Germany Spending Power

description: India’s most industrialized state in the south is pushing back against Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s attempts to reshape parliamentary constituencies based on population size, the latest sign of the growing regional divide in the country.
title: India’s Rich South Prepares to Fight Modi on Parliament Rejig

description: China’s National People’s Congress is convening from March 5 to 11, giving leaders a chance to set the economic direction of the country and lay out their spending plans for the year ahead.
title: How China Aims to Trump-Proof Its Economy as Top Lawmakers Meet

description: US President Donald Trump has long said he would negotiate a quick end to Russia’s war in Ukraine. In pursuit of a deal, the US has engaged with the Kremlin while pressuring Kyiv to support the peace initiative.
title: What Trump’s Pause on Military Aid Means for Ukraine

description: Indonesia is debating expanding the role of the country’s vast military under President Prabowo Subianto, including by allowing active armed forces personnel to take up civilian posts in ways not seen since the dismantling of strongman Suharto’s authoritarian systems decades ago.
title: Indonesia Debates Bigger Role for Military Under Prabowo

description: Democratic Senator Elissa Slotkin assailed President Donald Trump’s economic agenda after his address to Congress, accusing him and his billionaire adviser Elon Musk of targeting Social Security and other benefits.
title: Slotkin Slams Trump Over Tariffs and Musk in Democratic Response

description: President Donald Trump pointed to South Korea as a country with more unfair tariffs against American products than China, while slamming the handing out of subsidies for foreign chipmakers like Samsung Electronics Co.
title: Trump Puts Spotlight on South Korean ‘Higher-Than-China’ Tariffs

description: A tropical cyclone off Australia’s northeast coast that’s menacing the city of Brisbane could derail the government’s plans to call an election this weekend — after speculation mounted that Prime Minister Anthony Albanese was on the verge of setting an April 12 ballot.
title: Australia Cyclone May Prevent Albanese Calling April 12 Election

description: Outlining goals for his second term, the president asserted his opinion on topics such as tariffs that aren't supported by economic indicators and research.
title: What Trump Said About the US Economy, Fact-Checked

description: Taiwan is seeking closer security ties with the US and will look to buy more weapons from America, according to a senior official.
title: Taiwan Is ‘Praying’ for Stronger US Ties After Ukraine Fallout

description: Hundreds of US diplomats wrote a formal letter of protest to decry the dismantling of the US Agency for International Development, saying the move threatens US national security and caused “irreparable harm” to millions of people.
title: Diplomats Decry USAID’s Dismantling in Dissent Cable to Rubio

description: The US president’s interest in the Arctic island has shaken up campaigning for the March 11 vote.
title: Greenland Voters Weigh Their Election’s Most Important Issue: Trump

description: President Donald Trump delivered the biggest speech of his presidency yet, hitting on partisan talking points favored by his conservative base, while largely sidestepping the effects of his sweeping tariff proposals on consumers.
title: Tariff Defense, Democrats Protest: Takeaways From Trump’s Speech

description: President Donald Trump said the planner of an attack in Afghanistan that killed 13 American soldiers has been captured and is on the way to the US to face justice.
title: Trump Says Planner of Abbey Gate Attack in Afghanistan Captured

description: The Trump administration’s list of federal properties that could be offered for sale quickly shrank from 443 to 320 in the span of hours Tuesday, as the General Services Administration pulled some iconic buildings — including some agency headquarters — from the website.
title: More Than 100 Buildings Vanish From Trump’s ‘For Sale’ Wishlist

description: Fallout from a round of tariffs between the US and Canada could slash access to clean electricity in the biggest US city
title: New York’s Climate Goals Were in Tatters. Then Came the Trade War

description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday touted his administration’s work on a “gigantic natural gas pipeline in Alaska,” signifying his efforts to invigorate a long-stalled $44 billion project to transport natural gas across the state and export it overseas.
title: Trump Touts Plans to Spur Mammoth Alaska Gas Export Project

description: President Donald Trump took the lectern Tuesday for his primetime address beset by warning signs about the US economy, and acknowledged to Americans there could be more discomfort ahead.
title: Trump Warns Americans of Economic Discomfort as Trade War Erupts

description: Donald Trump promised on Day 1 to seize the Panama Canal.
title: BlackRock’s Fink Used Direct Line to Trump in Panama Canal Deal
Trump’s Address to Congress Spurs Rebuttal From Democrats
